title: Check data
code: vec <- c("Black", "Black+Cinnamon", "Cinnamon", NA) check_plus_in_primary_fur_color(primary_fur_color = vec) #> [1]  TRUE FALSE  TRUE    NA

title: Check data
code: both_valid_latitude <- c(40.766, 40.799) both_valid_longitude <- c(-73.96, -73.95) both_invalid_latitude <- c(30, 32) both_invalid_longitude <- c(-100, -99) one_invalid_latitude <- c(40.766, 50) one_invalid_longitude <- c(-73.95, -100)  check_coordinates(   latitude = both_valid_latitude,   longitude = both_valid_longitude ) #> [1] TRUE TRUE  check_coordinates(   latitude = both_invalid_latitude,   longitude = both_invalid_longitude ) #> [1] FALSE FALSE  check_coordinates(   latitude = one_invalid_latitude,   longitude = one_invalid_longitude ) #> [1]  TRUE FALSE

title: Get info about the dataset
code: You can get a message with the number of rows in a data frame of interest with `get_df_nrows()`. get_df_nrows(data = iris) #> The dataset is composed of 150 rows #> [1] 150
